title: Parli Vaijnath Temple
subtitle: One of the Twelve Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva
overview: Parli Vaijnath Temple, situated in the Beed district of Maharashtra, is one of the twelve revered Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva. It is said that worshipping here brings healing, peace, and liberation from worldly suffering.

The temple uniquely enshrines Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati together, symbolizing divine balance and harmony. The site is also associated with mythological events from the Ramayana and Mahabharata eras.
Built in the Hemadpanti architectural style, the temple’s black stone structure and elevated position make it a spiritually powerful and visually striking destination.

highlights.title: One of the Twelve Jyotirlingas
highlights.description: Parli Vaijnath is one of the sacred Jyotirlingas where Lord Shiva manifests as light and energy.

highlights.title: Hemadpanti Architecture
highlights.description: Constructed without mortar using intricately cut black stones, the temple reflects the architectural brilliance of medieval Maharashtra.

geography.intro: Parli Vaijnath lies amidst the scenic Balaghat range in Beed district, surrounded by hills and greenery that enhance its spiritual ambiance.

climate.description: Parli experiences a tropical climate with hot summers, mild winters, and a refreshing monsoon season.

geography.conclusion: Surrounded by scenic hills, the peaceful atmosphere of Parli Vaijnath enhances its divine charm.

activities.title: Jyotirlinga Darshan
activities.description: Experience divine energy while offering prayers to the self-manifested Shiva Lingam.
info: Special aartis held every morning and evening.
Devotees offer Bilva leaves, milk, and flowers to the deity.

activities.title: Attend Mahashivratri Festival
activities.description: The temple comes alive with thousands of devotees and grand processions celebrating Lord Shiva’s divine union.
info: Cultural programs and devotional songs are organized.

activities.title: Explore Surroundings
activities.description: The temple is surrounded by lush hills and small shrines dedicated to other deities.
info: Ideal for meditation and nature walks.
Shiva devotees also visit Amrit Kund nearby.

attractions.title: Amrit Kund
attractions.description: A sacred tank near the temple believed to possess healing powers.

attractions.title: Somnath Hill
attractions.description: A serene viewpoint offering panoramic views of Parli and its surrounding forests.

marineLife.intro: Parli Vaijnath is far from the coast but deeply enriched with spiritual and mythological essence.

items.title: Healing Energy
items.description: Devotees believe prayers here can heal ailments and bring peace.

items.title: Spiritual Purification
items.description: Bathing in the Amrit Kund is said to purify both body and soul.

conclusion: The temple’s divinity uplifts every visitor spiritually and emotionally.
Parli Vaijnath represents faith, health, and devotion in perfect harmony.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: The nearest airport is Latur (100 km) and Aurangabad (120 km).
Taxis and buses are available from both cities to Parli.

howToReach.title: By Train & Road
details: Parli Vaijnath Railway Station connects with major Maharashtra cities.
Regular buses operate from Beed, Latur, Nanded, and Aurangabad.

bookingTips.description: Visit early morning for peaceful darshan and minimal queues.
Book state transport buses or private cabs in advance during festival seasons.
Footwear must be removed before entering the temple premises.
